description.value:
You curse the target with rapid aging or erosion. The effect depends on whether the target is an object, a construct, or a living creature. Artifacts and objects and constructs made of precious materials (as determined by the GM), are immune.

  • Object If the object is attended, its bearer can attempt a Fortitude save. If the bearer fails or the object is unattended, the object immediately takes [[/r 4d6]] damage (applying Hardness normally) and the item is cursed with an unlimited duration. Until the curse ends, the item becomes shoddy and can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Repair]{Repaired}, and the curse attempts to counteract any spell that would restore the object's Hit Points. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Cleanse Affliction] can target an item affected by this spell.
  • Construct The construct takes [[/r 4d6]] damage (basic Fortitude save). On a failure, for 1 hour the construct is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Clumsy]{Clumsy 1}, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 1}, and can't be Repaired, and the curse attempts to counteract any spell that would restore the construct's Hit Points. On a critical failure, these effects have an unlimited duration.
  • Living Creature The living creature must attempt a Fortitude save. Ageless creatures are immune.

Critical Success The living creature is unaffected.

Success The living creature briefly ages, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Clumsy]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round.

Failure As success, with a duration of 1 hour.

Critical Failure As success, with an unlimited duration.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by [[/r 1d6]].

target.value: 1 Large or smaller object, construct, or living creature
